gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools

Class MaintenanceToolsImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools.MaintenanceToolsImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MaintenanceToolsBase
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BCMaintenanceToolsImpl

    public abstract class MaintenanceToolsImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements MaintenanceToolsBase
    The base class to methods used for managing the application. This is distinct from ISystemToolsAPI which is concerned with managing the application platform. There are application specific implementations of this class for each product.
    Author:
    mshaw

        public static final java.lang.String API_NAME

    • Method Detail

      • initializeBatchProcessMap

        protected abstract void initializeBatchProcessMap()
        Initialize any additional batch processes into the internal map that have not been initialized in initializeBaseBatchProcessMap(). New processes should be added using the addBatchProcess method.

        protected void initializeBaseBatchProcessMap()

                   BatchProcessType type)
        Add a batch process into the internal map by name. This will have no side effects after the initiazation
        Parameters:
        name - the old process name for the batch process
        type - the batch process type

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcess

        public boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcess(java.lang.String processName)
        Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
        Specified by:
        requestTerminationOfBatchProcess in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the batch process for which to request termination
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful, false if the process could not be terminated

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcess

        public boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcess(ProcessID pid)
        Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. Note that it's possible that this particular invocation could have finished and another invocation of the same process begun, in which case this won't request the termination of the current invocation. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
        Specified by:
        requestTerminationOfBatchProcess in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the process for which to request termination
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful, false if the process could not be terminated

      • batchProcessStatusByName

        public ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByName(java.lang.String processName)
        Gets the status of the given batch process, indicating whether or not the process is running and, if so, its current progress.
        Specified by:
        batchProcessStatusByName in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the process to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process

      • batchProcessStatusByID

        public ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByID(ProcessID pid)
        Gets the status of a particular batch process invocation. If that invocation is still running, the status will indicate as much, and only the startDate and opsCompleted fields will be filled in. Otherwise the returned object will contain information about the completed run (see ProcessStatus for information about all the fields returned).
        Specified by:
        batchProcessStatusByID in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process invocation

      • getWorkQueueConfig

        public WorkQueueConfig getWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String queueName)
        Get the current configuration of distributed workers for the specified work queue.
        Specified by:
        getWorkQueueConfig in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to query
        Returns:
        A WorkQueueConfig instance containing the current settings

      • setWorkQueueConfig

        public void setWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String queueName,
                      WorkQueueConfig config)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the configuration for distributed workers for the specified work queue. Any currently running worker instances will be stopped after the current workitem in process is completed. New worker instances as specified by the passed in config will be created and started. Note that the changes made here are temporary; if the server is restarted, the initial values from config.xml will be used when creating and starting workers. Note that WorkQueueConfig object must have all fields set. The recommended approach is to call getWorkQueueConfig(String) to get the current configuration, modify the retrieved object, and pass it to setWorkQueueConfig(String, WorkQueueConfig).
        Specified by:
        setWorkQueueConfig in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to modify
        config - The configuration to establish. Note that all fields must be on set this object before calling this method!
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getWorkQueueNames

        public java.lang.String[] getWorkQueueNames()
        Returns the list of work queue names for this product. These names may be used in getWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String) and setWorkQueueConfig(java.lang.String, gw.api.webservice.maintenanceTools.WorkQueueConfig).
        Specified by:
        getWorkQueueNames in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Returns:
        the array of work queue names

      • notifyQueueWorkers

        public void notifyQueueWorkers(java.lang.String queueName)
        Wakes up all workers for the specified queue across the cluster. Workers will check for workitems and will continue processing any found until the workitem table for the queue is empty.
        Specified by:
        notifyQueueWorkers in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to notify workers

        public boolean waitOnActiveWorkItems(java.lang.String queueName,
                            int maxWaitSecs,
                            long sleepMillis)
        This will wait for a specific number of seconds
        Specified by:
        waitOnActiveWorkItems in interface MaintenanceToolsBase
        Parameters:
        queueName - the name of the queue
        maxWaitSecs - the number of seconds to wait maximum, this must be balance by how long the request timeout is
        sleepMillis - the number of milliseconds to sleep each time there are still active work items
        Returns:
        true if the queue was empty
